p: To analyse the effects of climate change on adolescents, we use an existing definition and conceptual framework of adolescent wellbeing.4 Adolescent wellbeing is a state in which adolescents have the support, confidence, and resources to thrive, realising their full potential and rights.4 Good health and optimum nutrition are recognised as essential for adolescent wellbeing, acting as both determinants and outcomes of four other domains: connectedness, positive values, and contributions to society; safety and supportive environments; learning, education, and employability; and agency and resilience.
